info.title: Account Management API
info.description: API for managing 3scale Admin Portal objects, such as Accounts, Applications, Users, API products, gateway configurations etc.

org_name.description: Organization Name of the developer account.

username.description: Username of the admin user (on the new developer account).

account_plan_id.description: ID of the account plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

service_plan_id.description: ID of the service plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

application_plan_id.description: ID of the application plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

additional_fields[].description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 500.

additional_fields[].description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: buyer_provider_key
parameters.description: [Master API] Provider key of the account.

parameters.name: buyer_service_token
parameters.description: [Master API] Service token of the account service.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to be created.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the application to be created.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: User Key (API Key) of the application to be created.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description: App ID or Client ID (for OAuth and OpenID Connect authentication modes) of the application to be created.

parameters.name: application_key
parameters.description: App Key(s) or Client Secret (for OAuth and OpenID Connect authentication modes) of the application to be created.

parameters.name: redirect_url
parameters.description: Redirect URL for the OAuth request.

parameters.name: first_traffic_at
parameters.description: Timestamp of the first call made by the application.

parameters.name: first_daily_traffic_at
parameters.description: Timestamp of the first call on the last day when traffic was registered for the application ('Traffic On').

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: redirect_url
parameters.description: Redirect URL for the OAuth request.

parameters.name: first_traffic_at
parameters.description: Timestamp of the first call made by the application.

parameters.name: first_daily_traffic_at
parameters.description: Timestamp of the first call on the last day when traffic was registered for the application ('Traffic On').

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: plan_id
parameters.description: ID of the new application plan.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of referrer filter to be deleted.

plan_id.description: ID of the target account plan

credit_card_token.description: Token used by the payment gateway to identify the buyer, customer profile ID (Authorize.net), customer ID (Braintree and Stripe), customer alias (Ogone-Ingenico). Some payment gateways may store more than one card under the same buyer reference and/or require an additional identifier for recurring payment. If you are using Braintree, there is no need for additional identifier -- the first credit card available will always be charged. For Authorize.net, see `credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profile_token`.

credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profil.description: Additional reference provided by the payment gateway to identify a specific card under the same buyer reference. For Authorize.net, you MUST fill with the 'Payment profile token'

credit_card_expiration_year.description: Year of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

credit_card_expiration_month.description: Month of expiration of credit card. Two digit number

billing_address_name.description: Name of the person/company to bill

billing_address_address.description: Address associated to the credit card

credit_card_partial_number.description: Last four digits on the credit card

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). You can add as many as you want. Additional fields are the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). Additional fields are the custom fields declared for your tenant, you can find them in 'Settings >> Personal Details' for the account and in 'Settings >> Account >> Users >> Personal Details' for users. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be defined by name and value (i.e &name=value). Additional fields are the custom fields declared for your tenant, you can find them in 'Settings >> Personal Details' for the account and in 'Settings >> Account >> Users >> Personal Details' for users. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your custom fields.

put.summary: User Change Role to Admin (provider account)
User Change Role to Member (provider account)

parameters.name: allowed_service_ids[]
parameters.description: IDs of the services that need to be enabled, URL-encoded array. To disable all services, set the value to '[]'. To enable all services, add parameter 'allowed_service_ids[]' with no value to the 'curl' command (can't be done in ActiveDocs)

parameters.name: allowed_sections[]
parameters.description: The list of sections in the admin portal that the user can access, URL-encoded array. Possible values: 'portal' (Developer Portal), 'finance' (Billing), 'settings', 'partners' (Accounts -- Applications), 'monitoring' (Analytics), 'plans' (Integration & Application Plans), 'policy_registry'. To disable all sections, set the value to '[]'.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Permission of the access token. It must be either 'ro' (read only) or 'rw' (read and write).

parameters.name: scopes
parameters.description: Scope of the access token. URL-encoded array containing one or more of the possible values. The possible values are, for a master user ["account_management", "stats"], and for a tenant user ["finance", "account_management", "stats"]

parameters.name: approval_required
parameters.description: Set the 'Accounts require approval?' to 'true' or 'false'

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the object to be created. System names cannot be modified after creation, they are used as the key to identify the objects.

parameters.name: state_event
parameters.description: State event of the account plan. It can be 'publish' or 'hide'

parameters.name: system_name
parameters.description: System Name of the ActiveDocs spec. Only ASCII letters, numbers, dashes and underscores are allowed. If blank, 'system_name' will be generated from the 'name' parameter

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Service ID of the ActiveDocs spec

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ActiveDocs specification in JSON format (based on Swagger)

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to publish the spec on the developer portal, or 'false' to hide it. The default value is 'false'

parameters.name: skip_swagger_validations
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to skip validation of the Swagger specification, or 'false' to validate the spec. The default value is 'false'

parameters.description: Service ID of the ActiveDocs spec

parameters.name: skip_swagger_validations

parameters.description: Page in the paginated list. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of results per page. Default and max is 50.

parameters.name: useraccountarea_enabled
parameters.description: Allow the user to edit their submitted details, change passwords, etc

parameters.name: signups_enabled
parameters.description: Developers are allowed sign up themselves.

parameters.name: account_approval_required
parameters.description: Approval is required by you before developer accounts are activated.

parameters.name: strong_passwords_enabled
parameters.description: Require strong passwords from your users: Password must be at least 8 characters long, and contain both upper and lowercase letters, a digit and one special character of -+=><_$#.:;!?@&*()~][}{|. Existing passwords will still work.

parameters.name: public_search
parameters.description: Enables public search on Developer Portal

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL that will be notified about all the events

parameters.name: provider_actions
parameters.description: Dashboard actions fire webhooks. If false, only user actions in the portal trigger events.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Only failed webhook deliveries whose time is less than or equal to the passed time are destroyed (if used).
